title: Mindfulness for Stress Reduction
description: Learn basic mindfulness techniques to reduce stress and increase awareness

questions.prompt: Before we begin, rate your current stress level:
Take a moment to notice your surroundings. List 3 things you can see right now:
questions.placeholder: Example: The blue wall, my coffee mug, a plant

questions.prompt: Now, notice 2 things you can hear:
questions.placeholder: Example: The hum of the air conditioner, birds outside

questions.prompt: Notice 1 thing you can feel (a physical sensation):
questions.placeholder: Example: The texture of my clothes against my skin

questions.prompt: Take three deep breaths, inhaling for 4 counts and exhaling for 6 counts. Did you notice any change in how your body feels?
When practicing mindfulness, what should you do with thoughts that arise?
options: Try to push them away forcefully
Judge them as good or bad thoughts
Notice them without judgment and let them pass

questions.prompt: Focus on your breathing for 30 seconds. Describe what you noticed:
questions.placeholder: Example: I noticed my chest rising and falling. My mind wandered twice.

questions.prompt: Which of these is NOT a benefit of regular mindfulness practice?
options: Elimination of all negative thoughts permanently

questions.prompt: Think of one daily activity you could practice mindfully (with full attention):
questions.placeholder: Example: Brushing my teeth, drinking my morning coffee, walking to work

questions.prompt: After completing this exercise, rate your stress level again:
